include/freebus-debug.h File Reference

Header file to map debugging between several output devices. Possible outputs are lcd, uart and no debugging. To select the correct output define the compile variable DEBUG_LCD for lcd output DEBUG_UART for uart output HARDWARETEST for a hardware test DEBUG_BUSTIMING to test bus timing SENDTESTTEL if prog button is clicked a test telegram will be send. More...

#include <avr/pgmspace.h>
#include "lcd-lib.h"

Detailed Description

Header file to map debugging between several output devices. Possible outputs are lcd, uart and no debugging. To select the correct output define the compile variable DEBUG_LCD for lcd output DEBUG_UART for uart output HARDWARETEST for a hardware test DEBUG_BUSTIMING to test bus timing SENDTESTTEL if prog button is clicked a test telegram will be send.

Author:
Matthias Fechner
Date:
Sun Nov 18 19:01:35 2007

If none of them are defined, debugging messages are disabled.

The following debugging pins can be used:

  • DEBUG_PIN1 = PORTD, PD5
  • DEBUG_PIN2 = PORTD, PD6
  • DEBUG_PIN3 = PORTD, PD7
  • DEBUG_PIN4 = PORTC, PC2
  • DEBUG_PIN5 = PORTC, PC3
Bug:
If UART_DEBUG is enabled, a delay (about 1 second) by turning on switches occurs!
